overview: Berlin's delightful open-air venue the Waldbuhne amphitheater provides a stunning setting for this 1992 concert featuring the Berlin Philharmonic under the direction of Georges PrÃªtre in a program that celebrates French composers. Highlights include Leon Fleisher's interpretation of Maurice Ravel's "Concerto for the Left Hand," George Bizet's "Carmen Suite" and Hector Berlioz's "Roman Carnival Overture."
title: Waldbuhne Concert: French Night
